metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7097 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The filesystem implementation in the Linux kernel through 4.8.2 preserves the setgid bit during a setxattr call, which allows local users to gain group privileges by leveraging the existence of a setgid program with restrictions on execute permissions. Andreas Gruenbacher and Jan Kara discovered that the filesystem implementation in the Linux kernel did not clear the setgid bit during a setxattr call. A local attacker could use this to possibly elevate group privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7097` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-51-generic - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-lowlatency - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-4.4.0-51-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-51.72
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-51-generic - 4.4.0-51.72
No subscription required

linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-51.72').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
linux-euclid package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-9019.20').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-gcp package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.10.0-1004.4').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1038.45').
